website_summaries.verdict: A good value for a highly versatile desk, but we recommend the Prepac over it.
pros: The clever extra here is the swing-out section that virtually doubles your working area when you need it - but tucks neatly away when you don't
cons: The lower shelf isn't deep enough to fully support a computer placed back to front

customer_reviews.title: Love Love this desk
customer_reviews.text: How perfect was this!! It was just what I needed...simple design, on wheels, lightweight, easy to assemble myself, and plenty of room on main shelf for computer plus other items, and the side expandable desk has just as much room, plus the sliding keyboard pulls toward me so I'm not forced to type from out of comfort zone. Very nice look and plenty of room to it.
customer_reviews.author: Louise B

customer_reviews.title: Nice desk! Perfect for if you have dual monitors ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice desk ! Perfect for if you have dual monitors and music equipment. Took about an hour and a half to put together but the end result is worth it. Its sturdy too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The box it came it is more sturdy than the furniture
customer_reviews.text: One doesn't expect much for 90 dollars. However, one would expect the furniture to hold its own weight. I literally broke the rotating table moving the desk. I would not recommend this desk, even for 90 dollars. You would do better getting fruit boxes from the grocery store and stacking them. The hex wrench began to strip after the third screw. The tubing is so flimsy one hesitates to hold anything too tightly. Be forewarned, if you do for some reason want to tempt fate and buy this desk, don't put anything of value on it. It will probably cause the desk to collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for a home office shared space
customer_reviews.text: Desk is perfect for using in a bedroom or other shared space. It doesn’t overwhelm the room but with the L open it is more than enough space for a full size office. It’s simple and attractive enough even in our master bedroom. You really need 2 people to make set up easy. I don’t know if I was lucky and received a good one, but very few issues during putting together. If possible, use your own tools. It had a few minor imperfections, but once built and computer, monitors and printer set up you will never see anything wrong. For such a great price, it a lot of bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: K. Condon

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!!!  Great quality - Easy to Put Together!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how great this desk is. a) awesome design - so practical for small spaces b) it's become the desk I use for my home office c) it's well made - easy to put together d) I love how you can expand it by simply rolling out the middle section - smart design. I highly recommend this desk. It's made of good quality and will definitely hold up for a long time. Price - Outstanding - worth far more ----shh, don't tell anyone! :) haha By far - one of the best purchases I've made in a long time! (Ps: This shipped quickly and arrived in perfect condition)
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving only one star because of the below 3 things. 1. Item already started peeling within the package itself. My husband didn't noticed that, after starting assembling the desk I noticed. We didn't returned this because of point 2 2. Assembling the item is very very very difficult, it was like rocket science😣, we 2 spent more than 2 hours to assemble it. 3. Outside packing is worst. After seeing the packing, I thought i got a used one. Though I got new one there are damages on the item. We scared to dismantle the item, that is way we didn't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Netaji

customer_reviews.title: Not the most sturdy but sturdy enough for most home offices
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husbands new "home office" (gaming desktop) and its really attractive has plenty of space and is still quite compact and doesnt take up too much room. Its also customizable with the pull out portion of the desk. The instrucrions to put it together are very simple to understand. There are some parts that are difficult to accomplish which involve screws and an allen wrench in a tight space on the under part of the desk. I also wish it was more sturdy but its sturdy enough and cant be beat for the price! Hisband loves it and im very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: KyrannosaurusRex

customer_reviews.title: Great desk for space saving and value
customer_reviews.text: I had been putting off admitting that I needed a work station at home. When I finally gave in, I found this desk and knew it was what I needed. It came and was super easy to assemble (and I’m awful at that stuff). I set it up in about an hour and was ready to go. It’s not super sturdy, but it fits my needs and is compact enough to stuff into a corner. I’ve had it for about 3 months and can’t believe I put it off for so long.
customer_reviews.author: emiliey

customer_reviews.title: This is a shoddy Trainwreck
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst item I have put together. I have done this many times in my life. This desk was nightmare. Parts missing, holes not drilled and awkward to put together. I was almost done the pipe broke on the extension desk broke and there were no holes drill to attach the top. Buyer Beware. The price is now closer to 200 dollars, they didn't refund my credit card as I asked. They gave me a Amazon Credit.
customer_reviews.author: Meezer

customer_reviews.title: Nice setup
customer_reviews.text: Really nice but was missing all the wheels and coasters. They offered a refund or to send the missing parts when they become available in June. Which I hope to remeber to fulfill. I'm working for a medical facility from home due to COVID19 so I kept it out of need. There was nothing else online that wasn't expensive that could accommodate my multiple monitors, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Henhappy

customer_reviews.title: A total waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it "no stars", if it were possible. This product is poorly made. The holes don't line up. The curved tube would not line up with the desk top. Not only would it line up, the entire plastic screw hole piece popped out of the desk top, along with pieces of the desk. The holes, for the leg caps, are on an angle and the holes, to secure the back board, won't line up.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice desk, I put it together in about 2 hours but it might have gone faster if I wasn't eating breakfast. Includes a fat head screwdriver but you need a Philips to put it together. I recommend using your own adjustable wrench because the one included is garbage. You'll want a smart phone or a thin light you can put up to see where some of the screws go in but the instructions were simple and easy to follow. I'll wait sturdiness after seeing it in action for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Arock

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I needed a desk for the basement where I play music and game a little. I didn't expect much since it was so cheap and I got what I expected. Man, this thing was crooked as crap when I was piecing it together. Surprised I didn't strip some of the bolts. Caster are extremely crooked but they don't seem like they'll snap. If they do I'll just attach a stationary support. I will not be using the swing out portion. Honestly, I would not recommend this for anyone that isn't looking to fix it later.
customer_reviews.author: ellen lyons

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but lasts
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up so I could have an expandable workstation during my last couple years of college. It went on to serve me right up until we started our moving spree last year when I finally had to get rid of it as it had started warping from all the assembly and disassembly. It looks spartan, it's cheap, and it won't last forever. But if your just looking for something to hold your computer and reports for a couple years it should get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese junk . Wouldn't buy again. Design is neat but needs a lot of improvement. Mine already had rust on it with some of the flanges bent, box showed no sign of damage. Keyboard tray tabs seem as if they will break with the first few uses, and the keyboard tray is too low for me anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Sb

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this desk
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. I am very disappointed with this desk. All the metal parts are warped and the holes are bot made well. Some face different directions and I had to force the screws in. It was a pain to put together. I would return it but I decided to paint the metal BEFORE assembling it or inspecting it (face palm). I am now stuck with it. This is not an $80 desk. It's more like a $30 desk. Very wobbly and unstable.
customer_reviews.author: IndigoPhoenix

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required and it takes time, lots of pieces.
customer_reviews.text: If you like putting together furniture, this is the desk for you. Lots of parts but it comes with all hardware and tools to set-up. It is pretty sturdy and looks great when completed. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Good, for a simple lightweight desk.
customer_reviews.text: Decent material, but the welding is poorly done. After assembling the desk, I found that the caster wheels wouldn't rotate because the welds were misaligned. I removed the wheels it came with and used pipe clamps to put on my own. The desk is a little wobbly, however, mine is probably overloaded with a laptop, two monitors mounted to swingarms that I bolted to the rear of the desk, a soldering/rework station, and a benchtop power supply. If you don't plan to have a ton of stuff on the desk I'm sure it won't seem so unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for budget home studio.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my home recording studio. I have never been happier with a desk in that space than with this one. The swing arm holds my piano keyboard and folds in nicely when not needed. Has its space limitations as far as how much fits on its top, but for the price, who cares. I don’t want to spend thousands more just for a few extra square feet. Also, mine was shipped with a mis-welded part. The customer service was great and I got a new part the next day. Wish quality control was tighter, but at least they responded quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Teeth

customer_reviews.title: update
customer_reviews.text: I was using desk with the other level extended. decided to fold it into one unit and find the keyboard tray doesn't slide out far enough to accommodate wrist rest for keyboard and mouse comfortably. there is enough room for them as a shelf but not accessible comfortably. the top of keyboard is slightly under folded shelf and mouse can't move freely. perhaps another desk in in store when I move.and have more room
customer_reviews.author: Linda c

customer_reviews.title: Love it. It is sturdy and just the right ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is sturdy and just the right size to have my double monitor setup and my wall-mounted TV on top of them. However, I do not use the part where the keyboard and mouse are supposed to go because it is too low for me. No biggie, I leave my laptop and tablet there. My friends did not even notice they where there so It may be good for "hiding" stuff. All in all, I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Love it, except...
customer_reviews.text: Wheels are crap. They don't actually roll, just slide across the floor. I replaced them with rubber casters. One of the bolts where the stationary feet screws in is very crooked. Panel welds came loose in a few places. Will contact info on insert for replacements
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Atwater

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded my home office with this desk. I was worried because of some of the reviews on assembly. It’s heavy so get help! But hubby put it together perfectly without a hitch. Looks great and is very functional with the swinging work table. Glad I took a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Carletta Jones

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Several of the screws could not be screwed into the parts as they were not properly drilled. The desk is not sturdy at all and the middle desk shelf that slides out to create the L desk is very unstable. I would have returned it but they wanted the box repacked... I had a total of 4 screws that could not be used. I would not buy this desk again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Complete F'ing GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Didn't make it past step 1 of the instructions without running into trouble. As you can see from the pics. The bolt in the background is at an angle, and it should be straight. The front facing adjustable "foot" is all crooked. Just overall complete and utter GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy, but use able.
customer_reviews.text: The middle shelf, that rotates to the side, is flimsy and I wouldn't trust anything on it petmenant y. I also can't write on it bc it shakes and I'm afraid it's going to break. Without this the desk is fine but it's a real bummer. That's what u get for $30 As a stand alone desks there are better options.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle P.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed from this junk
customer_reviews.text: Holes don’t line up and scratches on the desk. They didn’t even provide a hex key and the screw driver is so weak it strip already. I guess I wasted my money on this garbage
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Had 1 problem.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice, sturdy, and easy to assemble desk. It looks nice and does everything it is supposed to. Sadly ome of the plastic guards that are supposed to keep you from getting cut was all warped and looked bad. Thankfully it was on the back side so I could just have it facing the wall and not see it, but if it had been on the front it woulda looked quite weird and would cut me whenever I pulled into the desk from where it was at. Maybe just check the product a bit better but besides that, the desk is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: VioletIsakawaii

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price.  Still not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Product is improperly manufactured. Poorly packaged. Customer service is next to non existant. Upon unboxing i decided to get past the shipping damage due to the poor packaging. Upon trying to assemble i discovered tabe legs that had been manufa tured so crooked i could not assemble. When contacted manufacturer they stated that i could wait 3 months for replacement parts or rebox and return to amazon. Packaging was so destroyed that i would have to go buy special shipping box and new packing material. Forget it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Halley

customer_reviews.title: The L shaped attachment broke immediately after assembly
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made attachments, I guess that's what you'll get for the price. Assembly wasn't the easiest too. The swivel attachment that connects the extension leg to the main desk is designed poorly and it broke immediately after assembly. I should have returned but somehow didnt want to go through the pain of tearing it apart and taking it to a UPS store. Save yourself some money and hassle by buying something expensive or an Ikea Desk.
customer_reviews.author: rs49er

customer_reviews.title: Would be a much better desk except for a few annoying things (see review)
customer_reviews.text: Bad manufacturing process. Paint is already peeling from the edge, one of the predrilled holes was not sized properly and I had to hammer the screw in, desk when finished is slightly wobbly, instructions could be better and more detailed, it is not easy to move this desk without two people. But for the price, I'm satisfied with the finished product.
customer_reviews.author: 801Jones

customer_reviews.title: My OneSpace Wonder
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter to work effectively from home. She loves it. I wasn't to sure what I was getting just trying to make life a little easier for my daughter to get her job done well with ample computer space. It fits nicely in my den. Nice purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: PAULETTE TILLMAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice desk!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for a small area. I almost did not purchase it due to the negative reviews. All parts came in perfect condition. Husband surprised me by assembling it for me. He said it was not difficult to do. All in all, a great size desk for my needs. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Delley's World

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for space savers, or standard desk size users!
customer_reviews.text: I love this desk! I can fold it in for easy walking room, and fold out when I'm ready to work on my 3 laptops and 32 inch monitor. You need to remember that the rough surface is the top surface... Remember this when you put the floor shelf on, or your floor shelf will be on the shiny side (the wrong side). Also, the more weight you put on it, the more you will have a tendency to damage areas of it. Mine is fine, but I have tested it with various weighted items. Excellent for the price and size!!
customer_reviews.author: successful_ladyj

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! You won’t regret this one
customer_reviews.text: This desk was very easy to assemble and does not feel cheap! It is very sturdy and versatile. It meets all my needs and I’m glad I decided on purchasing this product instead of the other options that were out there in this price range!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I like the desk
customer_reviews.text: I like the desk. It fits my room. The only issue I had was that the directions weren't as organized as they could have been. They had us putting one piece on before another making it very difficult to put the second piece on. We followed the directions exactly, however. I suggest that others look at the way the pieces go together before actually starting the screwing process.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: This is a super awesome computer desk on the budget
customer_reviews.text: This is a super awesome computer desk on the budget. Works great with two monitors, personally I have 3. It's not shaky, and I have it on carpet. My only complaint is that the keyboard drawer is very low, and not very wide. It only fits my keyboard and pretty much nothing else, so for typing, it's not a problem at all. If you want to game on your keyboard, this is going to be a bit awkward, as you'll likely have your mouse on a different level, like I do, on the side desk instead. However I game with a controller almost exclusively so this is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: MingYang L.

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT - Best for folks in IT with space constraints  !!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly designed. I am an IT guy who works from home. Most part of my day I spend on my laptop coding with multiple monitors . This table has solved many issues I had from a design, space, posture and flexibility perspective. Service : Incredible and prompt service from the seller. Pros: Design, Flexibility , Quality and Build Cons: The key board slider if this could be raised by few inches this would be one of a kind table.
customer_reviews.author: mpower4ru

customer_reviews.title: Like it but...
customer_reviews.text: I like it alot and was so excited but it was upsetting it was not double box because there was damage but due to the time I cannot go through the return process because how large this shipment is
customer_reviews.author: ANNE CIARLO

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and been pleased with furniture from Amazon. I will say this is not one of them. I have also purchased furniture from one well known box store and have never had an issue putting stuff together. The box came partially open. The majority of the screws got striped when being put together. Luckily my son is handy is able to make it work as I don't want to go thru the hassle of returning. Not one of my better purchases.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Product shipped highly defective.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly all the parts had warped metal, misaligned screw holes, or both. The allen wrech basically stopped working after minimal use, and even upon shipping in replacement parts and finishing assembly (save for the keyboard tray, because why bother at that point) the middle desk section would tilt forward dramatically at even the slightest pressure which, for a desk I intended to draw on, is a definite dealbreaker. I realize a fully non-defective model likely would not have these issues, but for them to give this unit the okay to ship to customers makes it highly unlikely this manufacturer will have my trust in future. Spend your money, and time, elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ashe G.

customer_reviews.title: ... received this item it was starched up it very sturdy I moved it a few times and then it ...
customer_reviews.text: When I received this item it was starched up it very sturdy I moved it a few times and then it broke. I this only last d a few weeks. I work from home and this product wasn’t worth what I paid for it. It was some what easy to put together instructions were awesome that’s about it
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: SPACE SAVING!! BANG for your BUCK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this desk. It is so convenient for a small space even a large space so the room doesn't look crowded. I bought it for a bedroom music studio and I can't wait to finish my room set up
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Boateng

customer_reviews.title: Good desk for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fine product overall. The desk arrived with a scratch on one of the surfaces. Desk was a little difficult to assemble, but I was able to do it my self for the most part. The movable part isn’t very sturdy, but It looks nice and will function for my son who has to study from home for the time being. I am over all pleased with it for the Very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really have to have a convertible work space in my studio and this does just that. All in all it took me about 1 hour to put together and I strongly recommend you have a electric driver to save you some time and energy. I would give this 4 stars however the wheels are a bit chintzy and don't work well and the last few step have you putting in screws upside down with an allen wrench in-between table tops. I created 4- 5 new swear words in the process. In the end I was very happy with the desk I would still recommend this product as its great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Robb Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok..
customer_reviews.text: Nice desk concept. The materials are pretty cheap, so if you're looking for something to use short-term this works. The wheels don't move when I engage the L portion of the desk, which is a pain. It serves its purpose for my home office set-up. If you're looking for good quality, spend a little more and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: TracieM

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy, and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this desk. It's pretty sturdy, all the pieces were there, instructions weren't terrible, and it fits my needs perfectly. 4 stars because one of the pieces had an end cap shoved down into it by a second end cap so I couldn't get a screw into it, I had to cut out the extra piece. After dealing with that everything has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L

customer_reviews.title: Great desk for small office
customer_reviews.text: Bought this desk for a my small office. It works great because one leaf opens to become an L shape, giving room to work but easily folds back when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Cheep
customer_reviews.text: This product showed up completely battered the box was open styrofoam everywhere. I needed it badly so kept it but covered in scratches, dings and bent metal
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Office or Bedroom
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our teenage son. He loves it and has it set up in its full "L" shape. The instructions were simple enough that he was able to put it together all by himself (his first piece of "self-assembled furniture")! At any one time, it holds his desktop machine, gaming keyboard, large monitor, several cans of soda, homework, a desklight, and several plates and bowls that should be in my dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shameful
customer_reviews.text: Shelf was all scratched up when I took it out the box. Can't send it back die to health issues. This product was not inspected before it was boxed up now I have to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Honey

customer_reviews.title: not all the Holes were able to be used
customer_reviews.text: There were a few holes that needed Screws to be used however they were to small or not really there. I love this desk for working at home but not really sturdy since i could not assemble all the way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough value for the price
customer_reviews.text: We needed a smaller footprint desk for my son's room since he was upgrading to a larger bed size. This desk seemed to fit the bill for the wall space it would occupy. It took about two hours to put together. Two small mistakes regarding pre-drilled areas on the pieces, but no biggie. The laminate top is fairly fragile so be careful putting it together. There's already have a small chip on the edge of the top piece (which we'll glue down and fill in the small crack lines with a sharpie) and some scuff marks from all the moving around while assembling. Hoping, the lifetime of this desk will be at least five years or more.
customer_reviews.author: MsTHS

customer_reviews.title: What a pain in the @ss desk
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, the material is cheap, the manual was written by a sadistic person and I'm not 100% sure the swing part of the desk is sturdy enough. It's easy to strip the screw heads with the allen wrench and some screws just don't want to go in all the way. Looks great though
customer_reviews.author: Pitfall

customer_reviews.title: it's ok - not the most stable
customer_reviews.text: For the $100 it's a decent desk. The level that swings out to make the L shape isn't very stable and the very top tends to lean forward if you put anything heavy (a monitor) on the front of it. The keyboard drawer is a little too low for me, but that's the case with most desks as I am tall. It also does not accommodate a mouse pad, which makes you put the mouse and keyboard on different levels (I do have a big keyboard with gaming pad on the side) - I plan to cut the keyboard drawer off and use the middle swinging surface for my keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazombie

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality materials, even when considering price. Packaging does not really protect the product well during shipping and several scratches in paint on metal parts is common. Assembly is not easy but with a helping hand you can make it. I expected more but at the same time am not surprised since it was so cheap to buy.
customer_reviews.author: RangersFanatic

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!  Maybe $75
customer_reviews.text: Very poor construction. Foot pads were not aligned in a straight row, so now it tilts if on a hard floor. A lot of the metal parts were scratched had to touch up paint. And several screw holes did not align up for the table top, had to re drill. I like the concept, just wish they would of paid better attention to assembly detail. Maybe this one was made on a Friday at 5 o'clock. Sure looked like it!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Nettles

customer_reviews.title: I like the swing out table top
customer_reviews.text: I like the swing out table top. Gives much more workspace. The desk is very flimsy and wiggles or moves when you type on a keyboard. There isn't a great place for using a mouse. Not enough room on the keyboard tray and it's at a different height on the other desk surfaces. Not the best for ergonomics! The top surface is very tall and places your monitor very high. Could lead to neck strain in some people.
customer_reviews.author: amazonaton

customer_reviews.title: Poorly manufactured but good for the price...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return parts 3 times to get fully assembled due to poor screw alignment or bent parts. Metal is thin and easily bent/damaged, but once together, for what you pay, it is a solid unit and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Desk
customer_reviews.text: The desk is excellent for my college son to have space for all of his computers plus room to work. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: However, I love the design of it, it is also larger then what I exspected.
customer_reviews.text: The construction on it from the manufacturer was sloppy, the welding on the legs were welded till the legs were bend in. I had someone to finally put it together, however, I it won't last long, I'm just not going to move it.
customer_reviews.author: theresa de'jarnette

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It kinda sucks putting the whole thing together with that tiny little tool they provide HOWEVER it was easy to assemble and it's perfect for my son's room. Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia B

customer_reviews.title: Came without ANY assembly instructions!!!
customer_reviews.text: Came without ANY assembly instructions!!! I tried searching the internet for them, tried looking on Amazon listing page for them -- NOTHING! Guess I'm stuck trying to figure this out myself with no instructions. Great..... The desk itself I had hopes for, but if I can't assemble it, then what's it worth???
customer_reviews.author: Titanium Coco

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Overall looks pretty nice but cheap welds and 1/3 of the holes stripped out easily. Holes didn't line up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cyr

customer_reviews.title: This desk looks great and is useful too!
customer_reviews.text: At first I had a dislike for this desk, and this was because of assembly was a real pain (I don't recommend doing it by yourself). I still actually don't have a screw in and my fingers still ache a little, but the work is all behind me now. This is a wonderful desk, and well worth the price I paid for it! It's keyboard panel tray is a little shaky (would highly recommend not leaning on it ever!) but the rest of the piece is sturdy! There is plenty of room for my two large monitors, laptop, and a book for school on the swivel desk. I would highly recommend this desk!
customer_reviews.author: Ryker Wells

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and good value!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these (one for each kids room) and are very happy! I agree with previous comments that there is really no reason to use the desk unless it's expanded so make sure you have the room to keep it expanded. My kids use it for a computer desk and school work desk. It has a nice, open design so it's easy to access wires and clean around the unit. I wish it had a bit more support for the expandable desk, but we've had both for about month now and it's holding up great. Considering the price, it's a very good-looking, useable piece.
customer_reviews.author: MOM23

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly simple assembly.Feels sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to assemble.Seems pretty sturdy.If it holds up it's a good choice,time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Love this desk!
customer_reviews.text: I love this desk. It’s the perfect size and you are able to extend the middle piece above the keyboard out for even more room, it’s almost like another desk in itself. The top of the desk fits my two monitors and my small laptop. My only complaint is that it’s pretty hard to assemble. In the end though, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Newman

customer_reviews.title: Junk!  Shop for something else.
customer_reviews.text: Thumbs Down! Seemed okay until I tried to assemble the side table. Junk. Can't imagine myself doing anything with the side table except ripping it off if that were possible. Seriously, save your money and look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: H.C.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last week and received it in an unopen package. I started putting it together and noticed some scratches and marks but didn’t think anything of it. The realized every one of them had marks on them looking like someone else used it and messed it up. I would not spend money on this you will get a used desk from who knows where
customer_reviews.author: Darden K.

customer_reviews.title: Look almost nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this with kinks and scratches and I'm not certain I even want to assemble or return it. Plus it got in late
customer_reviews.author: Ezra K.

customer_reviews.title: Really good Desk
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar desk at the same but from a different manufacturer. After all the various issues I had with that one, this one was a pleasure. The desk is sturdy, easy to assemble, and has very good directions.
customer_reviews.author: Dack Man

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small corner space option
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility of this desk. The packaging of screws and tools was great (labeled nicely). I put it together all by myself which was slightly difficult for a lady that doesn't ever do this kind of stuff but doable. It holds both 24 inch screens that I need for work.
customer_reviews.author: Holly V. Klein

customer_reviews.title: This company cares
customer_reviews.text: Desk took a long time to assemble. I would like it better if the pull out table could be set up for either left or right. Had a problem with my order and the company made it right! That goes a long way for me! I probably would’ve given a 2 star but the company’s response made it better!
customer_reviews.author: Christine G

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: I really want to leave a good review, I like the design. It’s great if you’re tight on space you can open the table when you need it and fold it back in when you don’t. My only issue with this product is that it had scratches all over. It looked like someone had previously bought the table and returned it. If I’m paying full price for something, I expect it to be new.
customer_reviews.author: Ezzeddeen Gazali

customer_reviews.title: Came without Hardware Kit
customer_reviews.text: The desk came in without the bag of screws and things you need to actually put the desk together. After contacting One Space, they said it would take over a month to get the parts to me so until then the desk is just a pile of parts on my floor. No Idea how good the actual desk is but it hasn't been great dealing with the company.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Yup,it's a desk!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy. Went together perfectly. Does exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgehiker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. I paid a good amount for this desk and discovered that there are missing pieces to it after I was almost done building it, and now I can’t get a replacement because it’s all out of stock and I need this desk to work remotely. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: MAI NGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy, difficult to assemble and not a sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived with scratches all over the wooden boards. The manual is worst I have cone across. The paints on some of the rods had come peeled off. Wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jithesh Nair

customer_reviews.title: It'll work, but keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are marginal at best, role out section is wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the supports in the picture may have been made of plastic. I was glad to see they are metal and support the structure pretty well. The assembly was very easy, even came with the allen key you will use for 95% of the job. Every part was labeled with a number too, even the screws. The metal parts are nice and threaded so you don't need any nuts to hold them in place. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because there was some damage to the desktop parts, most likely caused by shipping, but not enough for me to really care.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S

customer_reviews.title: Not super great, but it does work
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't super difficult to figure out how to set things up, but several parts felt like they were wrongly-sized, making it awkward to get some things in place or properly balanced. I mean, it does work, so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kline

customer_reviews.title: Desk
customer_reviews.text: It’s bigger than it looks, great quality and very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Journet

customer_reviews.title: height and botttom shelf
customer_reviews.text: it stands a little tall and the bottom shelf doesn't pull out far enough to use an ergonomic keyboard. so you have to pull the middle shelf out to the side or use the keyboard on the middle shelf. we also had to buy a taller chair so our elbows weren't shoulder height. it does look nice though.
customer_reviews.author: mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Nice desk but assembly sucks
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking sturdy desk I would buy again, assembly sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Love My New Desk.
customer_reviews.text: This desk is the bestest in the westest! I like the contemporary design and the ergonomics; I am 5'4" and the height is perfect. The price is right. It actually exceeded my quality expectations for the price. It was a bit tricky to assemble and had to re-do it once because put things backwards. Look at the photo while you are assembling. Anyhow, if you like the design, buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Gardengrrl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The desk worked well in my home office and is very spacious.
customer_reviews.author: SsyAriez79

customer_reviews.title: Great Desk for the Price
customer_reviews.text: All in all I love the desk! It fits perfectly in my office and the swivel table is an awesome bonus! I would have given it a 5, but one of the metal pieces came bent, but as it goes in the back it's not too noticeable, but still it's annoying to think you buy a new desk and it comes damaged, even if the damage was minimal. It also doesn't feel sturdy...it IS sturdy, it just doesn't feel like it sometimes. It was simple to put together and when I damaged a piece during the process, the customer support people were extremely courteous and helpful, and I got my replacement piece within 2 days. I would recommend this desk!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Sliter

customer_reviews.title: Nice desk with a nice price
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new desk. Great desk for the price. Fairly easy to assemble. Very sturdy for a 12 year old. I like the size and the ability to expand the desk when needed. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It broke while I put it together and then started falling apart when I tried to move it into place. The main desk is sagging under the weight of two small speakers. I should return it. But I'm not going thru the hassle of taking it apart.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product but, small keyboard area.
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. I actually have this desk sitting along the wall in my room with the extension always out. It gives me an amazing 8+ feet of counter top essentially. I had to modify the keyboard tray as it's not sufficient width for a proper mouse and keyboard. Other than that the desk is sturdy enough. It could be sturdier but you get what you pay for and honestly this desk is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Deez

customer_reviews.title: Small and low quality
customer_reviews.text: cheap junk. my keyboard (Corsair K70) is larger than the keyboard tray. scratch magnet and if you try to use the second row for your keyboard and mouse, most mousepads won't fit (part of it will be hanging off the edge). The top part is decently sized, but everything else is too small. Unless you have a mini-PC and dwarf sized peripherals, you won't like this for actual computer use or gaming.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice but Not Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The side desk is not sturdy at all. When placed one underneath the other, it looks nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Milan

customer_reviews.title: The perfect supprise and awesome gift.
customer_reviews.text: A well enjoyed and daily used for the home office.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generous in Size
customer_reviews.text: This desk is very BIG .. make no mistake, this isn't for the small corner in your room. It's sturdy but know the keyboard shelf doesn't tuck into the desk .. it sticks out a bit, but will slide out generously. The side arm is as long as the main part of the desk. The materials are sturdy and reliable, and desk overall took about 10 - 15 mins. to assemble (no problems).
customer_reviews.author: Christine Williams

customer_reviews.title: With a few tweaks could be the perfect work from home desk
customer_reviews.text: Needs 2 people to put together. Holes did not line up. Arrived scratched and chipped. Wish the keyboard shelf came out further or moved up and down. I am 5’8 and my knees hit the bottom shelf. The extendable arm is very spacious for writing etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Working from home I needed a confined space without taking up too much room. Very easy to put together...took about 40 mins tops! Stylish, perfect size for dual monitors, laptop, keyboard and writing space. Slightly unsturdy for the swing out desk but fine when writing.
customer_reviews.author: Asa B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Desk, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the finished product, would recommend for a first desk. It's easy to assemble and looks nice. Only reason for 4 stars is one hole didn't line up so had to leave that screw out, but it didn't take away from the sturdiness. Also came with a knick on the desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Spooner

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, sturdy, and delivered to me on time. I like having the versatility of being able to expand and downsize workspace when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not super high quality, but it's seem fair for the price. After putting it together seem to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: GPlayer

product_meta.title: OneSpace Regallo Expandable "L" Computer Desk
product_meta.description: Let your desk adapt to your space with the Regallo Expandable desk by Comfort Products. While closed, the work surface (41.5 inch W x 23.5 inch D) along with the top shelf (47 inch W x 15.75 inch D) provide plenty of room for a laptop or a desktop computer along with plenty of room for paperwork and anything else needed to tackle life's tasks. Needing to spread out? The work surface easily slides out to extend the table into an 'L' shape. When you're through with your task, simply slide the desk back under the upper top. Comfort Products develops, manufacturers, and markets targeted consumer products designed to improve and enhance the lives of consumers in a variety of applications. As the name implies, they put the "comfort" into daily life. With an emphasis on automotive, seating, and wellness products, Comfort Products has a long history dating back to 1919. For decades, the company has been a trailblazer in their product categories, and established long-standing relationships with their customers with loyal brand name followings such as Kool Kooshion, Relaxzen. Headquartered in Memphis, TN, America's distribution capital, the company has distribution facilities in Olive Branch, MS and Mesquite, TX, and permanent offices in Asia. Their long company history and strategic business partners allow them to provide quality products at tremendous values.
feature_bullets: Made of MDF, steel and PVC

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars575 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
